intro: Dinebra decipiens var. asthenes, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its dark green, waxy leaves and clusters of small, spadix-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in conservation efforts and natural habitats.
